title: About
text:
At the beginning of 2025, I started what I call my “Thinking Project.” In the last few months of 2024, I realized that the people around me spend a lot of time thinking deeply. They do research on topics they care about—ideas that aren’t just interesting to them but also important for the world. I admire that, and it made me reflect on my own habits. In a way, I felt like I wasn’t thinking enough.
So, I want to change that! My plan is to pick a topic every month or two, dive into research, and either form my own opinions or break down complex ideas. And since I could use some improvement in my writing (plus, making a webpage is fun), I’ll be posting about them here.
The Thinking Project has two parts:
Deep Dives – I explore broad, socially relevant topics I am interested in. I research, reflect, and write to clarify my thoughts. These pieces are, in a way, more personal.
Focus Sessions – I also started science-focused discussions with friends. Whenever I present, I’ll write about it here too. These pieces are more about facts than opinions.

At its core, this is an experiment in thinking more intentionally. 
 



Renee Garcia-Flores

I’m a Mexican scientist and bioinformatician in training, currently pursuing my PhD at Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory. I study how diet influences cancer progression and also work on fostering diversity in STEM as Co-President of DIAS. Outside the lab, you’ll probably find me running, reading emotionally intense fiction, or hanging out with friends and family. If you want to know more about me and my trajectory, feel free to check out my webpage!
